info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 5:40PM CDT until June 29 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Webster.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Finley River at Harmony Road, Givins Branch at Highway W, Finley River at Highway Z, Cantrell Creek at Scott Creek Road, Niangua River at Highway Y, James River at Bell Ford Road and Panther Creek at Highway B. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marshfield, Rogersville, Seymour, Fordland, Niangua, Diggins, Northview, Elkland and Rader. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING
